dataAnalysis

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataAnalysis.AbstractObservation
      • dataAnalysis.Observation
        • dataAnalysis.Statistics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DateTimeComparable

    public class Statistics
extends Observation
implements DateTimeComparable
    A single observation of weather data with relevant statistics. Stores the data, the sample station ID, whether the data is a valid sample, the date and time the sample was taken, the number of stations that reported values, and the type of statistic. It inherits from Observation and uses the interface DateTimeComparable.
    Version:
    2018-10-02
    Author:
    Robert Hill

    • Constructor Detail

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(double value,
                  java.lang.String stid,
                  java.time.ZonedDateTime dateTime,
                  int numberOfValidStations,
                  StatsType inStatType,
                  java.lang.String station)
        Constructor for Statistics. Takes in information on the observation and relavent statistical info as arguments. This specific constructor converts a String with the date/time data into a GregorianCalendar.
        Parameters:
        value - a double of the value of the given Statistics (either Temperature or Radiation)
        stid - a String of the stid of the given Statistics (showing the location of the Observation)
        numberOfValidStations - an int that represents the number of stations that reported valid data.
        inStatType - the type of Statistic this data point represents. Can be the average, minimum, maximum, or total.

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(double value,
                  java.lang.String stid,
                  java.util.GregorianCalendar dateTime,
                  int numberOfValidStations,
                  StatsType inStatType,
                  java.lang.String station)
        Constructor for Statistics. Takes in information on the observation and relavent statistical info as arguments. This specific constructor takes in a GregorianCalendar.
        Parameters:
        value - a double of the value of the given Statistics (either Temperature or Radiation)
        stid - a String of the stid of the given Statistics (showing the location of the Observation)
        numberOfValidStations - an int that represents the number of stations that reported valid data.
        inStatType - the type of Statistic this data point represents. Can be the average, minimum, maximum, or total.
